replies.bodyText: Same applies to the other rules.
replies.author: tiff

replies.bodyText: @vkyfox You need to add regexp_match="(?iu)(screencast)(s)?" to make it case-insensitive.
replies.author: jaumeortola

replies.bodyText:
Such does not seem to be the case in  rules as the capitalized examples I added are detected in the test runs. I suppose this has to do with the case_sensitive attribute for the token taking priority on the regexp itself?
I had to adjust the regexp in the suggestion for it to work properly, however, so thank you for bringing this to my attention!
replies.author: vkyfox

replies.bodyText: The pattern rules are case-insensitive by default. But the regexp_match (for generating suggestions) is case-sensitive. You can do regexp_match="([Ss]creenshot)(s)?" (for capitalized words) or regexp_match="(?iu)(screencast)(s)?" (fully case-insensitive).
replies.author: jaumeortola
